message: so, I've been developing a system that uses openid to log in, more specifically the contributed LJ backend; we have a place to host it for now but it's not very django-friendly and it's quite likely that we will move it to a different server in the (near) future, which may be with the same URL or a different one. Will moving everything (by dumping the database) affect logins? I don't know how openID works but I assume there's some secret key thing between the client and server and I'm worried that accounts won't carry over properly.
Didn't tried it, so, just guessing here actually, but if you keep the domain and the database data, of course, then no, users shouldn't have any issue with your move.
What if I change the domain? That's the main thing I'm worried about.
